decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats and disruption. Cards like Mishra's Bauble and Engineered Explosives allow for card advantage and removal, while cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga provide ramp and mana fixing. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can recur artifacts from the graveyard, keeping the pressure on the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to utilize the synergy between artifacts to create a fast and powerful aggressive strategy in the Modern format.

The deck aims to generate mana quickly through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while utilizing Ruby Medallion to reduce the cost of spells. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible provide card draw and selection, allowing the player to find combo pieces efficiently. The goal is to cast a large Grapeshot or Past in Flames to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The deck is focused on casting spells at a rapid pace and utilizing the combination of mana generation and card draw to overwhelm the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to control the game. It includes cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's plans, along with Fatal Push and Counterspell to deal with threats on the board. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Quantum Riddler to help draw into more answers. By managing the opponent's board and hand while maintaining resources, this deck aims to outlast its opponent and ultimately take control of the game.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to control the pace of the game. By playing efficient threats like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk, along with disruption from cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure. With support from cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Flickerwisp, the deck can also create versatile plays and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck seeks to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The key concept of the deck is to control the game by countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, and card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage. The inclusion of Psychic Frog provides additional card advantage and control elements. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the Grixis color combination, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and activating abilities. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through superior control.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures like Curator of Mysteries, Street Wraith, and Endurance, and then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. This allows you to overwhelm your opponent with a sudden influx of creatures and take control of the game. The deck also includes cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The goal is to effectively utilize the combo potential of Living End to secure victory in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and card draw, using Ral, Monsoon Mage to filter through the deck and cast spells more efficiently. The goal is to combo off with a combination of Past in Flames, Glimpse the Impossible, and Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes Wish to search for key pieces and has various land options for mana fixing. Overall, the key strategy is to chain together spells to create a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that generate mana or provide additional resources to play powerful creatures and control spells efficiently. By combining mana ramp with disruptive spells and evasive creatures with powerful abilities, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the tempo of the game. The inclusion of counterspells and removal adds another layer of versatility and adaptability to the strategy, allowing the player to react to various threats and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant to quickly ramp up mana and bring out powerful creatures. By using cards such as Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, the deck aims to efficiently search for and play these creatures to create a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Pact of Negation and Boseiju, Who Endures provide protection and support for the combo strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo quickly to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. Using cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate to fuel card draw and protect key combo pieces, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation. The strategy revolves around efficient reanimation of creatures and controlling the game until the combo can be assembled to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill cards to quickly deplete the opponent's library, triggering powerful effects such as Archive Trap. Cards like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab help speed up the milling process, while control spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch provide protection. The inclusion of Tasha's Hideous Laughter disrupts the opponent's game plan by exiling key cards. The deck also includes land destruction with Field of Ruin and control elements with cards like Surgical Extraction. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently mill the opponent's library to win the game.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on hand disruption and efficient removal spells to control the game while deploying aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Nethergoyf to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga to generate card advantage and assemble a strong board presence. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining consistent pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through a combination of efficient threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on a aggressive strategy that utilizes small creatures and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The key concept is to efficiently control the board through a combination of cheap removal spells and resilient threats, such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck aims to quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive creatures and disrupting their resources with cards like Quantum Riddler and Consign to Memory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through ramping up mana with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes board wipes like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to control the board, while also having access to removal spells like Unholy Heat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its large creatures and disrupt their strategy with its control elements, ultimately coming out ahead in the late game.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer for additional value and card advantage. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to be fast, aggressive, and relentless in dealing damage to the opponent.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using powerful creatures and burn spells. This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with cards like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also using direct damage from cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds additional ways to push through damage and close out the game quickly. With efficient removal and powerful threats, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.
